----\rTassajara Hills Elementary School\r4675 Camino Tassajara Rd. • Danville
column4: Principal\rahurlburt@srvusd.net\rthes-srvusd-ca.schoolloop.com/\r\r2018-19 School Accountability Report Card\rPublished During the 2019-20 School Year\r---\r-\r\rSchool Description\rTassajara Hills Elementary
column6: is situated in an idyllic and beautiful setting with\ropen hills to the east and south.  This suburban K-5 school located approximately 45 miles east of\rSan Francisco in the San Ramon Valley Unified School District
column7: serving a student population of\rapproximately 500 students.  It has been recognized as a California Distinguished School several\rtimes
column8: and most recently was recognized as a California Gold Ribbon school in 2016.  The school\roffers a rigorous
column10: academic program.\r\r------Visual and performing arts are a hallmark of the school and parent donations provide weekly music\r--instruction for all students.  Every child performs on stage annually in grade level musicals and\rSan Ramon Valley Unified Schoolfourth and fifth graders eagerly perform in the school band and orchestra.   Health and fitness\rDistrictremains a high priority among staff
column11: and students voluntarily participate in our "Stride for Pride"\r699 Old Orchard Dr.walk/run challenge weekly.  In addition to providing a challenging academic program
column13: CA 94526community is dedicated to the development of the "whole child".  Character education programs\r(925) 552-5500such as Sanford Harmony
column15: “Soul Shoppe” and Digital Citizenship lessons teach\rwww.srvusd.net\rconflict resolution and social skills. Fourth and fifth grade students provide leadership and facilitate\r\rDistrict Governing Boardcommunity service projects emphasize the importance of giving to those less fortunate than us.\r\rKen Mintz
column16: Board President\rTassajara Hills parents share our high expectations for all students.  Parents volunteer in excess of\rRachel Hurd
column18: 000 hours per year in order to support and enhance school programs. Parents are included in\rGreg Marvel
column19: Board Clerk\rthe decision making process through the Tassajara Education Foundation
column22: Board Member\rPTA.  Parent donations provide funding for additional personnel such as para educators and reading\rSusanna Ordway
column23: Board Memberintervention staff.  An extended contract for the library media coordinator and music teacher are\r\ralsofundedthroughparentdonations.Theclosecollaborationbetweenparentsandstaff\rDistrict Administration\rsignificantly contribute to the school's success.\rRick Schmitt\rSuperintendent\rToni Taylor\rDeputy Superintendent
column25: \rHuman Resources\rGregory Medici\rChief Business Officer\rBusiness Office\rGary Black\rAssistant Superintendent

column2: Average Class Size and Class Size Distribution (Elementary)\r2016-172016-172016-172016-172017-182017-182017-182017-182018-192018-192018-192018-19\rAverage# of# of# ofAverage# of# of# ofAverage# of# of# of\rGrade\rClassClasses*Classes*Classes*ClassClasses*Classes*Classes*ClassClasses*Classes*Classes*\rLevel\rSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSize\r1-2021-3233+1-2021-3233+1-2021-3233+\rK\r263253253\r\r1\r226253262\r\r2\r238244264\r\r3\r2382113224\r\r4\r324323273\r\r5\r3010273323\r\rOther**\r\r*Numbe r of classes indicates how many classes fall into each size category (a range of total students per class).\r** “Other” category is for multi-grade level classes.\r\rProfessional Development provided for Teachers\r\rMeasure2017-182018-192019-20\rNumber of school days dedicated to Staff Development and Continuous Improvement34.54.5\r\rThe San Ramon Valley Unified School District (SRVUSD) practices a comprehensive
column3: inclusive model of professional development for all staff. Our high\rquality professional development program is focused on Common Core State Standards (CCSS) as well as balanced literacy and instructional strategies.\rWe hold affiliation status with Columbia University Teachers' College Reading and Writing Project.\r\rIn addition
column4: every SRVUSD teacher is provided an opportunity to participate in a coach-led cohort to study instructional strategies in a small group setting.\rThese cohorts are both semester-long and yearlong and are focused on topics that run the gamut from Interactive Lecture to Reading Workshop for\rInnovators to Problem Solving Strategies. There are dozens of cohorts running simultaneously and teachers are able to select professional development\rthat best meets their needs.\r\rWe ensure that new teachers are provided support through the SRVUSD Teacher Induction Project. Our summer intensive training
column5: along with on-going\rstaff development days and release days
column6: align with the needs of our individual schools and our Framework for Excellence.\r\rthe leadership and guidance of site administrators
column7: such communities of practices afford our staff the opportunity to deepen their content knowledge
column10: and foster a shared sense of responsibility. As a result
column11: every staff member\rhelps to promote and nurture a community of learners in which the individual is enriched and the district as a whole is enhanced.\r\rFY 2017-18 Teacher and Administrative Salaries\rDistrictState Average for\rCategory\rAmountDistricts In Same Category\rBeginning Teacher Salary$49
column25: 796\r\rDistrictState Average for\rPercent of District Budget\rAmountDistricts In Same Category\rTeacher Salaries37%34%\rAdministrative Salaries5%5%\r*For detailed information on salaries

column2: Average Class Size and Class Size Distribution (Elementary)\r2016-172016-172016-172016-172017-182017-182017-182017-182018-192018-192018-192018-19\rAverage# of# of# ofAverage# of# of# ofAverage# of# of# of\rGrade\rClassClasses*Classes*Classes*ClassClasses*Classes*Classes*ClassClasses*Classes*Classes*\rLevel\rSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSize\r1-2021-3233+1-2021-3233+1-2021-3233+\rK\r263253253\r\r1\r226253262\r\r2\r238244264\r\r3\r2382113224\r\r4\r324323273\r\r5\r3010273323\r\rOther**\r\r*Numbe r of classes indicates how many classes fall into each size category (a range of total students per class).\r** “Other” category is for multi-grade level classes.\r\rProfessional Development provided for Teachers\r\rMeasure2017-182018-192019-20\rNumber of school days dedicated to Staff Development and Continuous Improvement34.54.5\r\rThe San Ramon Valley Unified School District (SRVUSD) practices a comprehensive
column3: inclusive model of professional development for all staff. Our high\rquality professional development program is focused on Common Core State Standards (CCSS) as well as balanced literacy and instructional strategies.\rWe hold affiliation status with Columbia University Teachers' College Reading and Writing Project.\r\rIn addition
column4: every SRVUSD teacher is provided an opportunity to participate in a coach-led cohort to study instructional strategies in a small group setting.\rThese cohorts are both semester-long and yearlong and are focused on topics that run the gamut from Interactive Lecture to Reading Workshop for\rInnovators to Problem Solving Strategies. There are dozens of cohorts running simultaneously and teachers are able to select professional development\rthat best meets their needs.\r\rWe ensure that new teachers are provided support through the SRVUSD Teacher Induction Project. Our summer intensive training
column5: along with on-going\rstaff development days and release days
column6: align with the needs of our individual schools and our Framework for Excellence.\r\rthe leadership and guidance of site administrators
column7: such communities of practices afford our staff the opportunity to deepen their content knowledge
column10: and foster a shared sense of responsibility. As a result
column11: every staff member\rhelps to promote and nurture a community of learners in which the individual is enriched and the district as a whole is enhanced.\r\rFY 2017-18 Teacher and Administrative Salaries\rDistrictState Average for\rCategory\rAmountDistricts In Same Category\rBeginning Teacher Salary$49
